Toggle Menu

salt.modules.timezone

Module for managing timezone on POSIX-like systems.

get_hwclock

Syntax

salt.modules.timezone.get_hwclock( )

Details

Get current hardware clock setting (UTC or localtime)

CLI Example:

salt '*' timezone.get_hwclock

get_offset

Syntax

salt.modules.timezone.get_offset( )

Details

Get current numeric timezone offset from UCT (i.e. -0700)

CLI Example:

salt '*' timezone.get_offset

get_zone

Syntax

salt.modules.timezone.get_zone( )

Details

Get current timezone (i.e. America/Denver)

CLI Example:

salt '*' timezone.get_zone

get_zonecode

Syntax

salt.modules.timezone.get_zonecode( )

Details

Get current timezone (i.e. PST, MDT, etc)

CLI Example:

salt '*' timezone.get_zonecode

set_hwclock

Syntax

salt.modules.timezone.set_hwclock(
								clock
								)

Details

Sets the hardware clock to be either UTC or localtime

CLI Example:

salt '*' timezone.set_hwclock UTC

set_zone

Syntax

salt.modules.timezone.set_zone(
								timezone
								)

Details

Unlinks, then symlinks /etc/localtime to the set timezone.

The timezone is crucial to several system processes, each of which SHOULD be restarted (for instance, whatever you system uses as its cron and syslog daemons). This will not be magically done for you!

CLI Example:

salt '*' timezone.set_zone 'America/Denver'

zone_compare

Syntax

salt.modules.timezone.zone_compare(
								timezone
								)

Details

Checks the hash sum between the given timezone, and the one set in /etc/localtime. Returns True if they match, and False if not. Mostly useful for running state checks.

CLI Example:

salt '*' timezone.zone_compare 'America/Denver'
